title: ['Icy Roads - Please Use Caution!', 'North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the season.']
description: ['The open roads in the park have lots of icy patches. Please drive slowly and with caution. All Oregon Chain Laws apply.', 'The North Entrance Road and East & West Rim Drives are now closed for the season a few The roads will not open again until mid to late June or July 2025. All other roads are open.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[], [{'title': 'Seasonal Closure of North Entrance Road and Rim Drive', 'id': '60D26BCB-B47D-4B38-8562-EF54ACF41B59', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Zion Canyon Scenic Drive is Temporarily Closed', 'Seasonal Road Closure - Kolob Terrace Road past Black Canyon', 'Please park legally and responsibly in Zion National Park and the Town of Springdale']
description: ['February 28, 2025 - Parking is full on the Zion Canyon Scenic Drive. The road will reopen to motor vehicles when parking space becomes available.', 'Kolob Terrace Road closed to non-tracked vehicles past Black Canyon (15 miles north of SR-9) due to snow and ice.', 'Zion has limited parking space. Park only in designated stalls. Vehicles parked outside of designated stalls are subject to citation and may be towed. Once all designated parking stalls in Zion are full, visitors should park in Springdale.']

title: ['Campground Closures', 'River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The following campgrounds are closed pending cleanup/repairs: Pulltite, Cedar Grove, Dee Murray, Akers, Sinking Creek, Broadfoot, and Jerktail. All other campgrounds are open as of 1/2/2025.', 'The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['Cave Mountain Road Temporary Closure', 'South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']
description: ['Newton County Road 5, also known as Cave Mountain Road, will be closed Mondays - Thursdays from 8am - 4pm for road improvements. The road will be open Fridays - Sundays to all traffic.', 'In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']
description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

title: ['Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive Winter & Spring Vehicle Road Closure']
description: ['This road is closed to vehicles. It remains open to foot traffic. The seasonal reopening date is determined by the amount of sand, hazard trees, and debris that will need to be cleaned up or moved after winter storms. This is typically in mid-May.']

park: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
title: ['North Rim Road and East Portal Road closed for winter', 'South Rim Road construction continuing in 2025']
description: ['North Rim Road and East Portal Road are closed. Both will reopen in spring as conditions permit. East Portal Road reopening is determined by the Bureau of Reclamation.', 'Major road improvement projects are complete for 2024. Construction will continue in 2025. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'North Rim Road/East Portal Road Winter Closure', 'id': '060EAF94-6CCC-4363-9729-4F81DFDF92C4', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blca/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'South Rim Road Construction', 'id': '75883C21-B99F-44AB-A551-DDBAD3306156', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blca/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

park: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument
title: ['Loop Road and North Entrance Seasonal Closures']
description: ['The Loop Road and North Entrance are closed to motorized vehicles for the winter starting 11/4. These areas are accessible by foot, bike, ski, and snowshoe. Restrooms and campsites are accessible but not maintained in the off-season. Learn more below.']

title: ['Road Construction Projects']
description: ['Parkway areas closed for ongoing road maintenance and construction projects.']

title: ['Tioga Road (Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the winter']
description: ['Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They usually open around late May or June. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions and tire chain requirements.']

title: ['Laurel Falls and other park trails are temporarily closed', 'Cosby Entrance Road closed for construction', 'Balsam Mountain, Cataloochee, and Big Creek areas closed', 'Most visitors need a parking tag']
description: ['For closure information and details on other trail cautions, please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page.', 'Rehabilitation began on December 9 for the 2.3-mile-long Cosby Entrance Road from TN State Route 32 to the gate of Cosby Campground. While crews are working, the entrance road is closed to the public. The work is projected to be completed in spring 2025.', 'While park staff address damage after Hurricane Helene, Balsam Mountain, Cataloochee, and Big Creek areas, campgrounds, and roads remain closed.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).']
relatedRoadEvents: [[], [{'title': 'Cosby Entrance Road closed for construction', 'id': 'F131F526-AA77-4EDE-BD1F-31EC7F5E2312', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Balsam Mountain, Cataloochee, and Big Creek areas closed', 'id': '6F2E112E-F026-4429-9548-1DA9B81CE784', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], []]

title: ['Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

title: ['Shafer Trail Road will close for maintenance March 3-6 and March 10-13']
description: ['Required maintenance will close this unpaved road at Island in the Sky to all use 7:30 am to 3:30 pm Monday March 3 to Thursday March 6, then again 7:30 am to 3:30 pm Monday March 10 to Thursday March 13. It will be open Friday through Sunday March 7-9.']

title: ['Rough and Damaged Roads']
description: ['Please drive slowly and exercise due caution when driving in Mojave National Preserve. Rough and damaged roads exist on both paved and unpaved roads. Watch for potholes.']

title: ['11/12/2024 - Lassen National Park Highway Closed']
description: ['The main park road (Hwy 89) is closed at Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center (southwest entrance) and Loomis Plaza/Manzanita Lake (northwest entrance) for the snow season. Please use caution if driving to the park and check weather forecasts:']

title: ['Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2025', 'Reds Meadow Road and Devils Postpile National Monument are closed for the season']
description: ['Reds Meadow Road and shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will only be open Fridays–Sundays (and on Thursdays with one-hour delays in July and August). The road will tentatively open for the season on July 3 and close October 6, 2025.', 'Reds Meadow Road, which provides access to Devils Postpile National Monument, is closed for the season.']

title: ['Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.']
description: ['Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4']

title: ['Winter Conditions', 'Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway: Hike and Bike Day']
description: ['Conditions change rapidly in the winter. Please click on this alert and scroll to the bottom of the page that opens to see current conditions of roads, trails, and campgrounds in the park.', 'The Newton B. Drury Parkway is closed to vehicles on the first Saturday of each month from October to May for Hike and Bike Day. The parkway closes on the Friday night before the event and reopens Sunday afternoon.']

title: ['Secondary Road Closures in Effect', 'Green River Ferry Status']
description: ['Houchin Ferry Road and Dennison Ferry Road are closed due to flooding that has deteriorated road conditions.', 'The Green River Ferry status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed.']

title: ['Miles Creston Road Project now open to traffic.', 'Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']
description: ['Miles Creston from Highway 2 to Copenhaver Road is currently a gravel roadway but will be hard surfaced in the late spring of 2025. Miles Creston is a main access to Lincoln Mill, Hawk Creek, and Seven Bays.', 'Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']

title: ['Adjustments to USS Cairo Museum and Visitor Center Days of Operation', 'National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians', 'Louisiana Circle Closed', "North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle Closed"]
description: ['Starting October 2, 2024, the USS Cairo Museum will be open 7 days a week and the Visitor Center will be open Wednesday-Sunday. The park grounds, fee booth, Visitor Center restrooms, and tour road will remain open seven days a week.', 'Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.', 'Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.', "Due to weather related incidents, North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle are closed to vehicular and recreational traffic. Entering these areas is prohibited. A portion of Grant Avenue is open for touring."]

park: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park
title: ['Overlook Parking Lot Unavailable After Dark']
description: ["The park parking lot at 72 McBride Extension is open from dawn to dusk every day. Any vehicles left in the parking lot after dusk (i.e. sunset) are subject to towing at owner's expense."]

title: ['Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park', "Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance", 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']
description: ['Tamiami Trail and State Road 9336 both have ongoing construction which may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly.', 'Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]

title: ['Highway Construction Impacting Travel to the Memorial']
description: ['Numerous highway construction projects are occurring in the Black Hills and may impact trip planning to the Memorial. Please consult with South Dakota 511 to minimize delays or other inconveniences.']

title: ['Emigrant Canyon Rd/Wildrose Area Closed Jan 6- Mar 31', 'Road work CA 190']
description: ['Emigrant Canyon Road will be temporarily closed for repair work to minimize future flood damage. No access to: Wildrose Charcoal Kilns, campgrounds (Wildrose, Thorndike and Mahogany Flat), trails (Wildrose and Telescope Peak) or dirt sideroads.', 'Expect delays up to 20 min along CA 190 between Towne Pass and Twenty Mule Team Canyon as Caltrans installs gabion structures to reduce the risk of road damage during flooding.']

title: ['Paradise Road Status: Open, traction tires advised, closing at 4 pm', 'Many park roads are closed for the winter season.', 'Always check signs on closed road gates before recreating; roads closed to all use if work underway.', 'All vehicles are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1 when traveling in the park.']
description: ['02/28/2025 All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD, must carry tire chains and be ready to use them. The road will close to uphill travel at 4 p.m. and downhill travel at 5 p.m.', 'Many park roads are closed for the winter season, including White River, Sunrise, Mowich Lake, Stevens Canyon, Westside Road, and SR410/123.', 'Closed roads may be open to non-motorized vehicles like bicycles. CHECK SIGNS on closed road gates before proceeding. During snow plowing operations or when otherwise posted, park roads are closed to all use, including hiking, bicycling, skiing, etc.', 'All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, must carry tire chains in the park during the winter season (November 1 - May 1) and be prepared to use them when tire chain requirements are posted.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Tire Chains Required, Closing at 3 pm', 'id': '4FC129ED-31D6-4FEA-835D-4510303EFABF', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/mora/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Closed for the Winter Season', 'id': '6E7D1A9C-253E-4183-9AAE-DED7F391C64B', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/mora/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [], []]

title: ['Hurricane Ridge Road Status, Friday 2/28, 8:40am', 'Hoh Rain Forest area closed due to county road damage']
description: ["There will be a delayed opening for Hurricane Ridge Road today. The road is expected to open at 9:30 AM. The children's sledding area is open, lifts and tubing area are closed. All vehicles traveling the road must carry chains.", 'The Hoh Rain Forest area is temporarily closed until the Upper Hoh Road, which is maintained by Jefferson County, is safe for travel. This closure applies to all traffic, including pedestrians and bicycles.']

title: ['Use Caution on Roads with Debris', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely']
description: ['Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.']

title: ['Jamestown Island Loop Roads Closed', 'Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Due to repairs taking place, The Jamestown Island Loop Drive is closed to all visitors, including pedestrians, cyclists, and vehicle traffic. The Island Loop Drive will reopen when it is safe to do so, likely in the Spring of 2025.', 'Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

park: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site
title: ['Main Parking Lot and Front Lake Trail Closed']
description: ["The Main Parking Lot, restrooms and front lake trail are closed due to impacts from Hurricane Helene. Access the Hiker's Parking Lot at 1924 Little River Road, limited to 24 spaces. Porta-toilets, trail maps, and park brochures available at this location."]

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['Several trails close March 1 for Peregrine falcon nesting season']
description: ['Effective March 1 until further notice, Penobscot East Trail, Jordan Cliffs Trail, Precipice Trail, and Valley Cove Trail will close to provide peregrine falcons adequate space for nesting. Also, the Precipice Trail parking lot will be closed to vehicles.']

title: ['Quarry Exhibit Hall Temporary Closure in Fall 2025', 'Harpers Corner Road Closure']
description: ['The Quarry Exhibit Hall with the "Wall of Bones" will be temporarily closed from September 8, 2025, to late October 2025 for a major road, parking lot, and sidewalk reconstruction project. There will be no visitor access to the fossils in the building.', 'The Harpers Corner Road is closed to vehicles for the winter season at the Plug Hat Butte gate, 5 miles north of HWY 40. Temporary closures south of Plug Hat Butte may occur as needed for snow clearing.']

title: ['State Route 148 closed for the winter season']
description: ['Visitors can access the park via Highway 143 and the town of Brian Head. You can view Cedar Breaks from the North View Overlook. State Route 143 will remain open, weather permitting.']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']
description: ['The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.']

title: ['Closure on Joyce Road NW for bridge replacement', 'Temporary Nighttime Road Closures for Deer Management']
description: ['Joyce Road NW is closed from the entrance of Rock Creek Park Golf Course to Missouri Ave NW while the bridge over Luzon Branch is replaced. Detours will be in place during the closure period.', 'From November 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025, the NPS may temporarily close select park roads between 5 p.m. to 4 a.m. to conduct deer management operations. Per the Rock Creek Park Superintendent’s Compendium, trails and other park areas close at sunset.']

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

park: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area
title: ['River Road Closed Due to Winter Conditions', 'Reduced Winter Services in Effect']
description: ['River Road is closed from Hialeah Recreation Site to Park Headquarters due to winter conditions and debris and downed trees from high wind incidents.', 'The winter maintenance plan is in effect for the season beginning January 2, 2024. Certain roads and areas may be closed or may not receive winter maintenance. Visit the Current Conditions page for more information.']

park: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine
title: ['Motorized Recreational Scooters Not Permitted in Park']
description: ['For the safety and protection of visitors and park resources, motorized scooters are not permitted within the park. Any vehicles (scooters, bicycles, etc.) that are part of a ride-share program may not be left behind for pick up inside the park']

title: ['New Mexico Road Advisories']
description: ['The New Mexico Department of Transportation updates its map of road advisories regularly. Visitors are encouraged to look for any possible road advisories along their route of travel beforehand.']

title: ['Fort Hunt Loop Road temporarily closed to vehicles']
description: ['The Fort Hunt Loop Road is temporarily closed to vehicles between Picnic Areas B and C due to maintenance work on a water leak. Pedestrians and bicyclists are able to move around the work zone marked with barrels and cones.']

title: ['Government Wash closure to vehicle access and overnight camping']
description: ['Government Wash Road and 8.0 Mile Road will be blocked, and motor vehicle access and overnight camping in the area will be prohibited. Hiking, biking, and shoreline access by boat for recreation within 100 feet of the shoreline will remain available.']

title: ["What's Closed and What's Open? (Park Operational Updates) Friday, February 28, 2025"]
description: ['South Rim Visitor Center is open today from 9 am to 4 pm. Ranger programs are being presented. Follow the link for a list of visitor services and their hours of operation. The North Rim has closed to all vehicle traffic for the winter. Reopens May 15.']

park: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']

title: ['Road Damage']
description: ['Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 ft not advised.']

title: ['Hozomeen Gate Remains Closed', 'State Route 20 Closed for the Season', 'Cascade River Road Seasonal Closure', 'Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20']
description: ['Until further notice, the gate at Hozomeen will remain closed; vehicle and foot traffic across the US/Canada border is prohibited. Visitors must enter through a designated port of entry.', 'State Route 20 is closed at milepost 134 (Ross Dam Trailhead) for the season due to heavy snowfall and risk of avalanche danger. Check the WSDOT real time map for up-to-date information, https://wsdot.com/Travel/Real-time/Map/.', 'Cascade River Road is closed for the season at Eldorado (milepost 20). Check the road conditions page for more information.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Paces Mill Closed for Planned Rehabilitation Project']
description: ['Paces Mill will be closed until May 2025 with no access to parking, facilities, or the canoe launch. The last park boat ramp south of US-41 is open with limited, non-parking vehicle access for take-out. Plan to exit the river before Paces!']

title: ['Dipsea Trail Footbridge Closed for Season', 'Parking Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['The Dipsea Trail footbridge crossing Redwood Creek has been removed for the season. Please detour via the Deer Park Fire Road and Muir Woods Road. This closure does not impact the main trails in Muir Woods.', 'Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']
description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']

title: ['Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?']
description: ['Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended']

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Road to Exit Glacier Closed to Automobiles']
description: ['The Alaska Department of Transportation has closed Herman Leirer Road for winter. Therefore, the road to Exit Glacier under the National Park Service is closed as well. Reopening is typically in mid to late-May, with variation due snow and weather.']

title: ['2/19/2025 Closure update for Chisha Foka Multi-Use trail rehabilitation']
description: ['2/19/2025, The\u202fChisha Foka\u202fMulti-Use\u202fTrail is closed from Old Canton Road to Reservoir Overlook Parking Lot and from Parkway Information Cabin to the HWY 51 intersection. The Info Cabin parking lot has limited parking.']

title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions']
description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is dry and rutted in spots. A high clearance vehicle is recommended.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Temporary Road Closures can Occur in Winter']
description: ['While the majority of park roads remain open, these three sometimes temporarily close to vehicles due to winter weather: Crystal Creek Road, Mill Creek Road, and Peltier Valley Road from Brandy Creek Road.']

title: ['Scenic Drive Rehabilitation Project', 'Visitor Center Parking Lot Construction']
description: ['The Scenic Drive is open through Capitol Gorge. Please drive carefully in construction areas. The road will fully close again in the spring, dates to be determined.', 'The visitor center parking lot is being expanded and reconfigured. It is partially closed to facilitate work. Look for signs to alternate parking for vehicles over 20 feet.']

title: ['Notice to travelers to National Cemetery']
description: ['Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.']

title: ['Bridge Closure on Sunflower Road']
description: ['Big Sandy Creek Unit: The bridge over Big Sandy Creek on Sunflower Road is closed for construction.']

title: ['Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']
description: ['Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ["Meriam's Corner parking lot to close for several weeks"]
description: ["Beginning Monday January 13, the parking area at Meriam's Corner will be closed to vehicles for the staging of construction materials. The closure will last several weeks Please use alternate parking lots across the park."]

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway', 'Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail']
description: ['There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.', 'Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.']

title: ['Flooding/bridge out on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek']
description: ['Increased rain and beaver dam activity flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail, washing out the bridge. Please use caution as you pass. Park staff is in the process of determining a route less prone to flood damage.']

title: ['Trail update 1/24/2025']
description: ['Most trails are open and ready for the public. Those that remain closed are the Charleston Road/ Goudey Trail past the Cherokee Path and the portion of Cherokee Path between the stockade fort and the Charleston Road.']

title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']
description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']

title: ['Road to Joyner Ridge Trail slick']
description: ['The dirt road that leads to the Joyner Ridge Trail is slick. Four-wheel drive strongly recommended.']

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['Fort Donelson NB Road Access on Winter Schedule Beginning Sunday, November 3, 2024']
description: ['From November 3, 2024, through March 9, 2025, vehicles may access park roads from 8:00 am to 4:30 pm for the winter season. Pedestrian Access remains from dawn to dusk.']

park: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve
title: ['Road Groomed for Winter Activity', 'Loop Road Closed to All Vehicles', 'Navigation']
description: ['Road grooming for Nordic skiing and snowshoeing will take place periodically.', 'The Loop Road is CLOSED to all vehicles. The park can still be accessed by foot, ski and snowshoe.', 'Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']

title: ['Winter Weather', 'Downed Trees on Trails']
description: ['Lava Beds received around 2 feet of snow. Please use caution if driving into the park as snow is starting to melt and cause icy road and parking lot conditions. All roads going into the Forest Service are not passable.', 'Please be cautions on all trails and side roads as high winds and heavy snow have caused several downed trees throughout the park.']

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

title: ['County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']
description: ['County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']

title: ['Box Canyon Day Use Area Closed']
description: ['Due to the recent illegal lighting of a fire in the trash bin, the theft of government signs, and the unauthorized movement of barricades to drive into an area closed to vehicle traffic, the metal gate at the upper end of Box Canyon has now been closed.']

title: ['Stage II Fire Restrictions']
description: ['Stage II Fire Restrictions will be in effect beginning Tuesday, January 21, 2025. Due to high fire danger, El Morro will implement Stage II Fire Restrictions. These include no campfires. No smoking except in an enclosed vehicle or other authorized area.']

title: ['Due to flooding access points to Bluestone National Scenic River are closed']
description: ['All access points to the park are currently closed. The road through Bluestone State Park and the Lilly access are currently closed due to flooding. Parts of the Bluestone Turnpike Trail may be flooded.']

title: ['Many Glacier Construction Closure', 'Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure']
description: ['Due to extremely limited parking during construction in the Swiftcurrent area, personal vehicle access into Many Glacier will be restricted from July 1-September 21, 2025. A temporary shuttle service will be provided for hikers wanting to access the area.', 'The Going-to-the-Sun Road is closed for the season at Lake McDonald Lodge on the west side and 1.5 miles west of St. Mary Visitor Center on the east side. Winter weather may change these locations at any time.']

title: ['Vehicle entrance reservation not needed', 'Most Park Roads Open to Guided Oversnow Tours Only']
description: ['Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.', 'In winter, most roads are only open to commercially-guided snowcoach and snowmobile tours. The road between the North and Northeast entrances is the only road open year-round to regular vehicles.']

title: ['Generals Highway Between Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks Closed for the Winter Season', 'Several Small Roads Closed Due to Roadway Damage Or Snow Accumulation', 'Crescent Meadow Road and Moro Rock Loop Road Closed For the Season Due To Snow Accumulation', 'Highway 180 Access To Cedar Grove Area of Kings Canyon National Park Closed For the Season', 'Mineral King Road Is Closed For the Season']
description: ['Generals Highway is closed between the junction with Wolverton Road and Montecito Sequoia Lodge. This is a normal winter closure due to snow and ice accumulation. This section of the highway is expected to reopen March 21.', 'These roads are closed due to roadway damage during past storm events or due to snow accumulation: Crystal Cave Rd, Middle Fork Rd, Redwood Canyon Rd, South Fork Rd, Panoramic Point Rd, Main Sherman Tree Parking, lower parking lot at Giant Forest Museum', 'The roads are closed to vehicle traffic for the winter season, but will remain open to winter recreation such as hiking, snowshoeing, and cross-country skiing. Roads will reopen in spring when the snow melts.', 'Highway 180 is closed east of Hume Lake Road for the winter season. Cedar Grove is not accessible. This section of road typically reopens in late April.', 'The portion of Mineral King Road inside Sequoia National Park is closed for the winter season to the general public. The road typically reopens in May on the Wednesday before Memorial Day, but could be later depending on conditions.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Generals Highway Seasonal Closure Between Sequoia and Kings Canyon Parks', 'id': 'D51F91A9-B316-4029-B911-2D8AD67FB5D4', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Road Closures Related to Past Storm Events and Snow Accumulation', 'id': '667EE370-7B7C-4A64-85CA-051F5C27F309', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Crescent Meadow Road and Moro Rock Loop Road Temporary Closure', 'id': '54962ED2-C44A-43E6-9B3B-87B60352FC2E', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Highway 180 Seasonal Closure', 'id': '02698AFD-CAAE-434F-8312-C023124680DA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Mineral King Road Seasonal Closure', 'id': '5096154A-71A4-4F51-A7F8-98E102608092', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Trail closure for pipeline restoration project', 'Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season']
description: ['The VC09/South Valle Toledo/Posos Trail from the Valle Toledo parking area to the eastern park boundary is closed for restoration. The NPS is working on a trail reroute for the 2025 season and will provide details as soon as possible.', 'The backcountry vehicle route has closed for the season until May 15, 2025. As conditions allow, the route will be maintained as a groomed ski and snowshoe trail from the Cabin District to the horse barn near Cerro Piñon.']

title: ['Icy roads and trails']
description: ['Take extra caution when driving and hiking in the park. Roads and trails, while open, may be slippery due to snow and ice.']

title: ['Portion of Kekaulike Avenue in Kula to close for approximately nine months', 'Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']
description: ['A portion of Kekaulike Avenue (Route 377) between Waiakoa Road and ʻAlae Road will be closed for 24 hours, seven days a week, for approximately nine months.', 'Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']

title: ['Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about mobile devices and map/navigation apps', 'Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.']
description: ['Map apps may direct you to Parashant if you search for directions to "Grand Canyon" due the canyon\'s name in both the national park and monument names. The national park has paved roads and services. Parashant has no services and rugged/remote conditions.', 'Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.']

title: ['Vehicle Length & Trailer Restrictions']
description: ['No large vehicle turnaround after Faraway Ranch Parking Lot (1 mile after entrance). Vehicles over 29 feet park at Faraway. Disconnect trailers at Faraway. Trailers with campground reservations proceed directly to camp.']

title: ['Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Season']
description: ['Trail Ridge Road (U.S. Hwy 34) is closed to vehicles to through travel for the season. Trail Ridge Road is closed on the east side of the park at Many Parks Curve and on the west side of the park at Colorado River Trailhead.']

title: ['Road Open To: Mile 13 (Mountain Vista)', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']
description: ['The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 13, Mountain Vista. Wintry conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']

park: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]

title: ['Expect Winter Driving Conditions on Rim Rock Drive']
description: ['Rim Rock Drive is open, but drivers should expect winter driving conditions at higher elevations. Drive carefully. Some shaded areas along the road are icy and snow-packed. Call 970-858-2800 ext. 350 for current conditions.']

title: ['Park Hours may Change due to Winter Storms']
description: ['Winter storms and ice may cause opening delays or temporary closures allowing plows to safely clear the roads. Before visiting, check this page daily for up-to-date information. Colorado Traction Law may apply, see info below. Click link for weather']

title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']
description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']

title: ['Road to East End']
description: ['Recent rains have caused an overgrowth of vegetation on the sides of the road heading to East End near Haulover. Please use extreme caution when driving. This park alert will be removed once the vegetations has been removed.']

title: ['Winter Road Closures', 'Miners River Bridge Closed']
description: ['Sand Point Road is the only road maintained by the park in the winter. All other park roads, including Miners Castle Road and Chapel Road are not plowed within the park boundary.', 'The bridge connecting Miners Castle Road to Miners Beach is closed for a full bridge replacement. Closures will go through spring 2025.']

park: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site
title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]

title: ['Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']
description: ['The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']

title: ['Bottomland Nature Trail Will be Closed Starting September 3rd', 'Dangerous Highway Crossing']
description: ['The Bottomland Nature Trail will be closed beginning September 3rd for the trail resurfacing project. It will remain closed until work is complete. Fox Creek Trail remains open, but can only be accessed from the north through the under highway crossing.', 'Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']

park: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site
title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']

title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']
description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']

title: ['If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route']
description: ["You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011."]

park: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve
title: ['Fayette Station Road closure Jan 6 to March 28', 'Cunard Road closed from November 1 to about March 31, 2025']
description: ['The WV DOH will be closing the Tunny Hunsaker Bridge on Fayette Station Road from January 6 through March 28 for bridge deck replacement. The road will be closed from Taeys Landing on the north side to the end of the one-way traffic on the south side.', 'Improvements to Cunard Road will begin on Monday November 4, 2024 extending through winter to about March 31, 2025. The road will be completely closed during this time.']

title: ['Old East Entrance Station Parking Area Closure', 'South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']
description: ['The Old East Entrance Station parking area will be closed to visitor traffic for the winter. Coal Vein Road will be the temporary visitor/vehicle turn-around area.', 'Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']

title: ['Closed for Winter Season']
description: ['The Wall Street side of the Navajo Loop Trail is closed. The roads to Paria View and Fairyland Point are closed to vehicles. The Overflow Park Lot for the Mossy Cave Trail is closed.']

title: ['Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ["Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

title: ['Mica View Trail closed for resurfacing', 'Vehicle Break-Ins']
description: ['The Mica View Trail in the Rincon Mountain District will be closed from February 18th to April 30th for resurfacing work. Both the Mica View Picnic Area and the Broadway Trailhead will remain open during the construction.', "Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]

title: ['Service Road Closure']
description: ['The walkway toward the lighthouse is closed to due construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.']

title: ['Oversized Vehicles are Unable to Park in Visitor Center Parking Lot']
description: ['Due to construction, oversized vehicles will not be allowed to park in the visitor center parking lot due to lack of space and ability to turn-around safely. There is oversized parking along the main park road.']
